item.title: Actor and comedian Fred Willard dead at 86
item.description:
Fred Willard, beloved actor and comedian, has died, aged 86.
"My father passed away very peacefully last night at the fantastic age of 86 years old," his daughter Hope Mulbarger said in a statement ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202021/GettyImages-665546408_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Actor Fred Willard attends the 50th anniversary screening of In The Heat Of The Night at the 2017 TCM Classic Film Festival opening night gala. Photo / Getty Images

item.title: Workers distraught after restaurant chain lays off 150 despite wage subsidy
item.description: Hospitality chain the Good Group - owners of upmarket waterfront restaurants such as Botswana Butchery and White & Wongs - has made half of its more than 300 staff redundant amid the Covid-19 crisis. ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/goodgroup_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Staff from the Good Group's Queenstown restaurants and bars Magalí Gómez Espina, Camila Rouco Oliva and Mackenzie Mercer say they are distraught at being let go. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/chloe_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Raise The Bar founder Chloe Ann King says the Good Group's decision doesn't make sense. Photo / Supplied

item.title: No exceptions: PM, Clarke Gayford turned away after cafe limit reached
item.description:
Nobody is exempt from coronavirus restrictions – not even the Prime Minister.
Jacinda Ardern was turned away from a Wellington cafe, Olive, this morning because it had already reached its limit of customers ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/PMClarke_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Jacinda Ardern and Clarke Gayford were turned away from Wellington cafe Olive because it had already reached its limit of customers under level 2 rules. But there was a happy ending. Photo / File
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/olive_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Olive is on Cuba St in Wellington. File photo / Getty Images

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Business, Premium, Economy, Coronavirus, Budget 2020, Earthquakes, Unemployment, Immigration, Mental Health, Aviation
item.title: Liam Dann: Even in the middle-class bubbles there is profound sadness
item.description:
Now what New Zealand?
We did it.
We got through lockdown. We crushed the Covid-19 curve. We're open for business.
We didn't even run out of toilet paper.
If we take a deep breath and look back ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/SCCZEN_140520WCBRCLev07_70x71.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=People headed back to some sort of ordinary life with post-lockdown coffee as the country went into level 2. Photo / Bevan Conley

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202020/SCCZEN_A_310320SPLAIRNZ3_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Borders closed: Air new Zealand Airbus A320 aeroplanes parked at Auckland Airport in March. Photo / Supplied

item.title: New research: Loud talking can leave coronavirus in air for 14 minutes
item.description:
Speaking loudly can leave coronavirus lingering in the air for up to 14 minutes, new research has discovered.
Scientists found that thousands of tiny droplets sprayed from the mouths of people talking ...
